intro: Silene hicesiae, commonly known as the Greek catchfly, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family and typically grows in dry, rocky habitats. The plant produces small, pink or purple flowers that bloom in early summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, and it has a compact, low-growing habit. Silene hicesiae is often found in open areas such as grasslands and woodland edges.
